058/**
059 * A taglet that represents the {@code @snippet} tag.
060 */
061public class SnippetTaglet extends BaseTaglet {
062
063    public enum Language {
064
065        JAVA("java"),
066        PROPERTIES("properties");
067
068        private static final Map<String, Language> languages;
069
070        static {
071            Map<String, Language> tmp = new HashMap<>();
072            for (var language : values()) {
073                String id = Objects.requireNonNull(language.identifier);
074                if (tmp.put(id, language) != null)
075                    throw new IllegalStateException(); // 1-1 correspondence
076            }
077            languages = Map.copyOf(tmp);
078        }
079
080        Language(String id) {
081            identifier = id;
082        }
083
084        private final String identifier;
085
086        public static Optional<Language> of(String identifier) {
087            if (identifier == null)
088                return Optional.empty();
089            return Optional.ofNullable(languages.get(identifier));
090        }
091
092        public String getIdentifier() {
093            return identifier;
094        }
095    }
096
097    public SnippetTaglet() {
098        super(DocTree.Kind.SNIPPET, true, EnumSet.allOf(Taglet.Location.class));
099    }
100
101    /*
102     * A snippet can specify content by value (inline), by reference (external)
103     * or both (hybrid).
104     *
105     * To specify content by value, a snippet uses its body; the body of
106     * a snippet is the content.
107     *
108     * To specify content by reference, a snippet uses either the "class"
109     * or "file" attribute; the value of that attribute refers to the content.
110     *
111     * A snippet can specify the "region" attribute. That attribute refines
112     * the location of the content. The value of that attribute must match
113     * one of the named regions in the snippets content.
114     */
115    @Override
116    public Content getInlineTagOutput(Element holder, DocTree tag,
117            TagletWriter writer) {
118        try {
119            return generateContent(holder, tag, writer);
120        } catch (BadSnippetException e) {
121            error(writer, holder, e.tag(), e.key(), e.args());
122            String details = writer.configuration().getDocResources()
123                .getText(e.key(), e.args());
124            return badSnippet(writer, Optional.of(details));
125        }
126    }
127
128    private static final class BadSnippetException extends Exception {
129
130        @java.io.Serial
131        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1;
132
133        private final transient DocTree tag;
134        private final String key;
135        private final transient Object[] args;
136
137        BadSnippetException(DocTree tag, String key, Object... args) {
138            this.tag = tag;
139            this.key = key;
140            this.args = args;
141        }
142
143        DocTree tag() {
144            return tag;
145        }
146
147        String key() {
148            return key;
149        }
150
151        Object[] args() {
152            return args;
153        }
154    }
155
156    private Content generateContent(Element holder, DocTree tag,
157            TagletWriter writer)
158            throws BadSnippetException {
159        SnippetTree snippetTag = (SnippetTree) tag;
160
161        // organize snippet attributes in a map, performing basic checks along
162        // the way
163        Map<String, AttributeTree> attributes = new HashMap<>();
164        for (DocTree d : snippetTag.getAttributes()) {
165            if (!(d instanceof AttributeTree a)) {
166                continue; // this might be an ErroneousTree
167            }
168            if (attributes.putIfAbsent(a.getName().toString(), a) == null) {
169                continue;
170            }
171            // two like-named attributes found; although we report on the most
172            // recently encountered of the two, the iteration order might differ
173            // from the source order (see JDK-8266826)
174            throw new BadSnippetException(a, "doclet.tag.attribute.repeated",
175                a.getName().toString());
176        }
177
178        final String CLASS = "class";
179        final String FILE = "file";
180
181        final boolean containsClass = attributes.containsKey(CLASS);
182        final boolean containsFile = attributes.containsKey(FILE);
183        final boolean containsBody = snippetTag.getBody() != null;
184
185        if (containsClass && containsFile) {
186            throw new BadSnippetException(attributes.get(CLASS),
187                "doclet.snippet.contents.ambiguity.external");
188        } else if (!containsClass && !containsFile && !containsBody) {
189            throw new BadSnippetException(tag, "doclet.snippet.contents.none");
190        }
191
192        String regionName = null;
193        AttributeTree region = attributes.get("region");
194        if (region != null) {
195            regionName = stringValueOf(region);
196            if (regionName.isBlank()) {
197                throw new BadSnippetException(region,
198                    "doclet.tag.attribute.value.illegal",
199                    "region", region.getValue());
200            }
201        }
202
203        String inlineContent = null, externalContent = null;
204
205        if (containsBody) {
206            inlineContent = snippetTag.getBody().getBody();
207        }
208
209        FileObject fileObject = null;
210
211        if (containsFile || containsClass) {
212            AttributeTree a;
213            String v = containsFile
214                ? stringValueOf((a = attributes.get(FILE)))
215                : stringValueOf((a = attributes.get(CLASS))).replace(".", "/")
216                    + ".java";
217
218            if (v.isBlank()) {
219                throw new BadSnippetException(a,
220                    "doclet.tag.attribute.value.illegal",
221                    containsFile ? FILE : CLASS, v);
222            }
223
224            // we didn't create JavaFileManager, so we won't close it; even if
225            // an error occurs
226            var fileManager = writer.configuration().getFileManager();
227
228            try {
229                // first, look in local snippet-files subdirectory
230                var utils = writer.configuration().utils;
231                var pkg = getPackageElement(holder, utils);
232                var pkgLocation = utils.getLocationForPackage(pkg);
233                var pkgName = pkg.getQualifiedName().toString(); // note: empty
234                                                                 // string for
235                                                                 // unnamed
236                                                                 // package
237                var relativeName = "snippet-files/" + v;
238                fileObject = fileManager.getFileForInput(pkgLocation, pkgName,
239                    relativeName);
240
241                // if not found in local snippet-files directory, look on
242                // snippet path
243                if (fileObject == null
244                    && fileManager.hasLocation(Location.SNIPPET_PATH)) {
245                    fileObject = fileManager
246                        .getFileForInput(Location.SNIPPET_PATH, "", v);
247                }
248            } catch (IOException | IllegalArgumentException e) { // TODO: test
249                                                                 // this when
250                                                                 // JDK-8276892
251                                                                 // is
252                                                                 // integrated
253                // JavaFileManager.getFileForInput can throw
254                // IllegalArgumentException in certain cases
255                throw new BadSnippetException(a, "doclet.exception.read.file",
256                    v, e);
257            }
258
259            if (fileObject == null) {
260                // i.e. the file does not exist
261                throw new BadSnippetException(a,
262                    "doclet.snippet_file_not_found", v);
263            }
264
265            try {
266                externalContent = fileObject.getCharContent(true).toString();
267            } catch (IOException e) {  // TODO: test this when JDK-8276892 is
268                                       // integrated
269                throw new BadSnippetException(a, "doclet.exception.read.file",
270                    fileObject.getName(), e);
271            }
272        }
273
274        String lang = null;
275        AttributeTree langAttr = attributes.get("lang");
276        if (langAttr != null) {
277            lang = stringValueOf(langAttr);
278        } else if (containsClass) {
279            lang = "java";
280        } else if (containsFile) {
281            lang = languageFromFileName(fileObject.getName());
282        }
283
284        Optional<Language> language = Language.of(lang);
285
286        // TODO cache parsed external snippet (WeakHashMap)
287
288        StyledText inlineSnippet = null;
289        StyledText externalSnippet = null;
290
291        try {
292            Diags d = (text, pos) -> {
293                var path = writer.configuration().utils.getCommentHelper(holder)
294                    .getDocTreePath(snippetTag.getBody());
295                writer.configuration().getReporter().print(
296                    Diagnostic.Kind.WARNING,
297                    path, pos, pos, pos, text);
298            };
299            if (inlineContent != null) {
300                inlineSnippet = parse(writer.configuration().getDocResources(),
301                    d, language, inlineContent);
302            }
303        } catch (ParseException e) {
304            var path = writer.configuration().utils.getCommentHelper(holder)
305                .getDocTreePath(snippetTag.getBody());
306            // TODO: there should be a method in Messages; that method should
307            // mirror Reporter's; use that method instead accessing Reporter.
308            String msg = writer.configuration().getDocResources()
309                .getText("doclet.snippet.markup", e.getMessage());
310            writer.configuration().getReporter().print(Diagnostic.Kind.ERROR,
311                path, e.getPosition(), e.getPosition(), e.getPosition(), msg);
312            return badSnippet(writer, Optional.of(e.getMessage()));
313        }
314
315        try {
316            var finalFileObject = fileObject;
317            Diags d = (text, pos) -> writer.configuration().getMessages()
318                .warning(finalFileObject, pos, pos, pos, text);
319            if (externalContent != null) {
320                externalSnippet
321                    = parse(writer.configuration().getDocResources(), d,
322                        language, externalContent);
323            }
324        } catch (ParseException e) {
325            assert fileObject != null;
326            writer.configuration().getMessages().error(fileObject,
327                e.getPosition(),
328                e.getPosition(), e.getPosition(), "doclet.snippet.markup",
329                e.getMessage());
330            return badSnippet(writer, Optional.of(e.getMessage()));
331        }
332
333        // the region must be matched at least in one content: it can be matched
334        // in both, but never in none
335        if (regionName != null) {
336            StyledText r1 = null;
337            StyledText r2 = null;
338            if (inlineSnippet != null) {
339                r1 = inlineSnippet.getBookmarkedText(regionName);
340                if (r1 != null) {
341                    inlineSnippet = r1;
342                }
343            }
344            if (externalSnippet != null) {
345                r2 = externalSnippet.getBookmarkedText(regionName);
346                if (r2 != null) {
347                    externalSnippet = r2;
348                }
349            }
350            if (r1 == null && r2 == null) {
351                throw new BadSnippetException(tag,
352                    "doclet.snippet.region.not_found", regionName);
353            }
354        }
355
356        if (inlineSnippet != null) {
357            inlineSnippet = toDisplayForm(inlineSnippet);
358        }
359
360        if (externalSnippet != null) {
361            externalSnippet = toDisplayForm(externalSnippet);
362        }
363
364        if (inlineSnippet != null && externalSnippet != null) {
365            String inlineStr = inlineSnippet.asCharSequence().toString();
366            String externalStr = externalSnippet.asCharSequence().toString();
367            if (!Objects.equals(inlineStr, externalStr)) {
368                throw new BadSnippetException(tag,
369                    "doclet.snippet.contents.mismatch",
370                    diff(inlineStr, externalStr));
371            }
372        }
373
374        assert inlineSnippet != null || externalSnippet != null;
375        StyledText text
376            = inlineSnippet != null ? inlineSnippet : externalSnippet;
377
378        AttributeTree idAttr = attributes.get("id");
379        String id = idAttr == null
380            ? null
381            : stringValueOf(idAttr);
382
383        return writer.snippetTagOutput(holder, snippetTag, text, id, lang);
384    }
385
386    /*
387     * Maybe there's a case for implementing a proper (or at least more helpful)
388     * diff view, but for now simply outputting both sides of a hybrid snippet
389     * would do. A user could then use a diff tool of their choice to compare
390     * those sides.
391     *
392     * There's a separate issue of mapping discrepancies back to their
393     * originating source in the doc comment and the external file. Maybe there
394     * is a value in it, or maybe there isn't. In any case, accurate mapping
395     * would not be trivial to code.
396     */
397    private static String diff(String inline, String external) {
398        return """
399                ----------------- inline -------------------
400                %s
401                ----------------- external -----------------
402                %s
403                """.formatted(inline, external);
404    }
405
406    private StyledText parse(Resources resources, Diags diags,
407            Optional<Language> language, String content) throws ParseException {
408        Parser.Result result
409            = new Parser(resources).parse(diags, language, content);
410        result.actions().forEach(Action::perform);
411        return result.text();
412    }
413
414    public interface Diags {
415        void warn(String text, int pos);
416    }
417
418    private static String stringValueOf(AttributeTree at)
419            throws BadSnippetException {
420        if (at.getValueKind() == AttributeTree.ValueKind.EMPTY) {
421            throw new BadSnippetException(at,
422                "doclet.tag.attribute.value.missing",
423                at.getName().toString());
424        }
425        return at.getValue().stream()
426            // value consists of TextTree or ErroneousTree nodes;
427            // ErroneousTree is a subtype of TextTree
428            .map(t -> ((TextTree) t).getBody())
429            .collect(Collectors.joining());
430    }
431
432    private String languageFromFileName(String fileName) {
433        // TODO: find a way to extend/customize the list of recognized file name
434        // extensions
435        if (fileName.endsWith(".java")) {
436            return "java";
437        } else if (fileName.endsWith(".properties")) {
438            return "properties";
439        }
440        return null;
441    }
442
443    private void error(TagletWriter writer, Element holder, DocTree tag,
444            String key, Object... args) {
445        writer.configuration().getMessages().error(
446            writer.configuration().utils.getCommentHelper(holder)
447                .getDocTreePath(tag),
448            key, args);
449    }
450
451    private Content badSnippet(TagletWriter writer, Optional<String> details) {
452        Resources resources = writer.configuration().getDocResources();
453        return writer.invalidTagOutput(
454            resources.getText("doclet.tag.invalid", "snippet"), details);
455    }
456
457    private static PackageElement getPackageElement(Element e, Utils utils) {
458        if (e instanceof DocletElement de) {
459            return de.getPackageElement();
460        } else {
461            return utils.elementUtils.getPackageOf(e);
462        }
463    }
464
465    /*
466     * Returns a version of styled text that can be rendered into HTML or
467     * compared to another such version. The latter is used to decide if inline
468     * and external parts of a hybrid snippet match.
469     *
470     * Use this method to obtain a final version of text. After all
471     * transformations on text have been performed, call this method with that
472     * text and then use the returned result as described above.
473     */
474    private static StyledText toDisplayForm(StyledText source) {
475        var sourceString = source.asCharSequence().toString();
476        var result = new StyledText();
477        var originalLines = sourceString.lines().iterator();
478        var unindentedLines = sourceString.stripIndent().lines().iterator();
479        // done; the rest of the method translates the stripIndent
480        // transformation performed on a character sequence to the styled
481        // text that this sequence originates from, line by line
482        int pos = 0;
483        // overcome a "quirk" of String.lines
484        boolean endsWithLineFeed = !sourceString.isEmpty()
485            && sourceString.charAt(source.length() - 1) == '\n';
486        while (originalLines.hasNext() && unindentedLines.hasNext()) { // [^1]
487            String originalLine = originalLines.next();
488            String unindentedLine = unindentedLines.next();
489            // the search MUST succeed
490            int idx = originalLine.indexOf(unindentedLine);
491            // assume newlines are always of the \n form
492            // append the found fragment
493            result.append(
494                source.subText(pos + idx, pos + idx + unindentedLine.length()));
495            // append the possibly styled newline, but not if it's the last line
496            int eol = pos + originalLine.length();
497            if (originalLines.hasNext() || endsWithLineFeed) {
498                result.append(source.subText(eol, eol + 1));
499            }
500            pos = eol + 1;
501        }
502        return result;
503        // [^1]: Checking hasNext() on both iterators might look unnecessary.
504        // However, there are strings for which those iterators return different
505        // number of lines. That is, there exists a string s, such that
506        //
507        // s.lines().count() != s.stripIndent().lines().count()
508        //
509        // The most trivial example of such a string is " ". In fact, any string
510        // with a trailing non-empty blank line would do.
511    }
